III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 7/24/25 around 9-9:30 am, prior to going to the cafeteria, youth
was trying to take a shower, the shower was occupied. He was
told by staff that he needed to go to his room and wait for a
shower. Youth got upset and put his things down. Youth then
swung at staff; he then went down the hall. Another staff
intervened, and the youth started kicking at that staff. Youth stood
up and the first staff grabbed him by the collar and threw youth to
the ground. Staff was attempting to escort youth to the cafeteria.
Youth dropped to the floor. Youth was on the floor kicking a
couple of staff but then got on his feet. Youth lunged at a staff and
tried to punch her in the face. Youth then landed on the floor and
staff observed with her arm extended in front of her and hand up
to demonstrate for youth to stop. Youth then got off the floor and
another staff got between staff and youth, and he tried to swing at
staff and was "cussing" at her. Youth has scratches on his chest
below his collar bone and on his right arm. There is no video
footage of the incident. Youth was seen by the facility in-house
nurse. The superficial marks will be treated with antibiotics and
band aids. Staff is being moved to a different part of the building
during investigation.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Assistant Program Manager 1 (APM 1) was interviewed face
to face at the facility on 7/29/25 in collaboration with Law
Enforcement and MDHHS Worker 1. APM 1 reported he was on
a different unit and received a text from Case Manager stating
Youth A was going to be escorted to the cafeteria. APM 1 reported
Case Manager had a bum hand, and she was supervising, so he
went to swap out with her. APM 1 reported when he arrived, Case
Manager was standing at the door to the cafeteria and had the
door open, therefore he took over. APM 1 reported he stood there
for about 15-20 seconds thinking staff were bringing Youth A, but
they didn’t arrive. APM 1 reported he went around the corner and
saw Youth A on his back on the floor with his feet kicking at Staff 1
and Staff 4. APM 1 reported when Youth A saw him, he stood up
2

and walked towards him into the common area with Staff 1 and
Staff 4 following. APM 1 reported he went back and opened the
door to the cafeteria to see if Youth A would follow him. However,
while APM 1 was opening the door, Youth A lunged at Staff 1.
APM 1 reported when he turned around, Youth A was on the
ground on his side, and Staff 1 had her arm extended into a “stop”
motion. APM 1 reported he went over and did a motion telling
Staff 1 to walk away and Staff 1 left the unit. APM 1 reported as
Staff 1 was walking away, Youth A attempted to hit her again.
APM 1 reported he blocked the hit and put his arm around Youth
A's shoulder to let him know he was safe and told him the physical
part of the interaction needed to be done. Staff 4 opened the
cafeteria door, and APM 1 moved his hand from Youth A’s
shoulder to his back to escort Youth A into the cafeteria. APM 1
reported Youth A yelled, cussed, and threatened he was going to
hurt Staff 1. APM 1 reported he encouraged Youth A to take deep
breaths and use his coping skills. APM 1 reported during the
conversation after Youth A calmed down, Youth A reported Staff 1
grabbed him by the collar and pushed him to the ground and he
wanted to file a grievance. APM 1 reported he assisted Youth A
with filing the grievance. APM 1 reported Youth A had some
scratches on his neck and hand. APM 1 reported he never saw
Staff 1 or Staff 4 grab, restrain, or push Youth A. AMP 1 reported
he has never had any concerns with Staff 1 or Staff 4 being
malicious towards youth. APM 1 reported APM 2 was down the
hallway with the other youth, so he didn’t think she saw anything,
and Staff 2 and Staff 3 were not present when he was there.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/29/25
in collaboration with Law Enforcement and MDHHS Worker 1.
Youth A reported he put his clothes on the ground and was
waiting for the shower to be available. Youth A reported Staff 4
told him to pick up his clothes and bring his clothes with him, so
he went to the milieu to wait like she said. Youth A reported Staff 4
went to another unit and then Staff 1 told Youth A to go wait in his
room. Youth A reported he was pacing, and Staff 1 began saying
stuff to get him annoyed (couldn’t remember what), so he “threw
hands at her”. Youth A reported Staff 1 improperly restrained him
by twisting his wrist, pushing him to the ground, and grabbing his
shirt. Youth A reported Staff 4 came to assist and she was also
using improper training. Youth A reported Staff 1 and Staff 4
grabbed him by his collar, twisted his arm, pushed him into walls,
and swung him around to throw him on the ground. Youth A
reported when he was on the ground, he was trying to get through
Staff 1 and Staff 4’s legs to take a break in the hallway, but they
told him no and used their legs to push him backwards. Youth A
3

reported they weren’t giving him space to calm down. Youth A
reported he wanted time in the hallway to calm down before going
to the cafeteria. Youth A reported APM 1 was present for half of
the situation and escorted him to the cafeteria to help him calm
down. Youth A reported APM 1 helped him file a grievance. Youth
A reported he called Staff 1 and Staff 4 the “N-word”, but he
doesn’t remember anything they said to him. Youth A reported
there were no other youth or staff around. Youth A reported the
marks on his legs/knees were from a couple weeks ago.
Case Manager (CM) was interviewed face to face at the facility
on 7/29/25 in collaboration with Law Enforcement and MDHHS
Worker 1. CM reported she was sitting on the unit before
everything started, and she was talking to another youth. CM
reported Staff 1 and Youth A were standing near them and Youth
A asked Staff 1 for something. CM reported Staff 1 told Youth A
he needed to wait in his room with his shower stuff, and he asked
Staff 1 why. CM reported she wasn’t sure why Staff 1 told him no.
CM reported Staff 1 stood up and Youth A began yelling and
calling Staff 1 many vulgar names. CM reported Youth A began
walking towards Staff 1 and Staff 1 did an approved blocking
technique. CM reported she walked over to hold open the
cafeteria door so Staff 1 could escort Youth A there. CM reported
Staff 3 stood near them and Staff 4 assisted Staff 1. CM reported
she couldn’t see everything from where she was standing. CM
reported APM 1 switched out with her, and she went to a different
unit. CM reported she never saw staff put their hands on or near
Youth A when she was watching.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/29/25
in collaboration with Law Enforcement and MDHHS Worker 1.
Staff 1 reported in the morning youth were getting up and ready
for the day. Staff 1 reported Youth A came to wait for the shower,
but he had pajamas in his hands instead of his clean clothes for
the day. Staff 1 reported another youth was in the shower, so she
told Youth A to go back to his room to get his clothes for the day,
make sure his room was clean, etc. Staff 1 reported she pointed
out the list of everything Youth A had to do before starting the day
and Youth B was also telling Youth A what the schedule was. Staff
1 reported Youth A began pacing by the medication room. Staff 1
reported she reiterated to him what the rules and tasks were he
had to follow. Staff 1 reported Youth A dropped his clothes outside
the medication room and then charged at her trying to punch her.
Staff 1 reported she blocked his punches, and Youth A kept
charging at her, which backed her into a cubby hole on the unit.
Staff 1 reported she did not restrain him and kept blocking him.
4

Staff 1 reported Staff 4 came running down and asked Youth A
why he was swinging on Staff 1. Staff 4 asked Youth A to walk
himself to the cafeteria to calm down and keep the other youth
safe. Staff 1 reported Youth A ran down the hallway by the laundry
room when Youth C came out of the shower with his stuff. Staff 1
reported she and Staff 4 blocked Youth A so he wouldn’t attack
Youth C. Staff 1 reported she and Staff 4 tried to escort Youth A,
but he dropped his weight, and they went hands off. Staff 1
reported Youth A was lying on his back on the floor and began
kicking at her and Staff 4. Staff 1 reported APM 1 was standing at
the end of the hallway. Staff 1 reported Youth A got off the floor,
walked to the milieu, turned around, and said, “I’m going to whoop
this nigger’s bitch ass”. Staff 1 reported Youth A tried to swing on
her again, but APM 1 blocked it and escorted Youth A to the
cafeteria. Staff 1 reported at the beginning of the incident, Case
Manager, Staff 3 and APM 2 were present, but then APM 2 and
Staff 3 took the other youth off the unit for safety. Staff 1 reported
Case Manager switched out with APM 1. Staff 1 reported at no
point Youth A was on the floor on his knees trying to push through
her and Staff 4’s legs and they never pushed him backwards. Staff
1 reported at no point did she or Staff 4 grab Youth A’s shirt. Staff
1 reported she and Staff 4 never pushed, pulled, grabbed his arm
or twisted his arm during the situation and never threw him to the
ground. Staff 1 reported they never restrained him, and all she did
was block him from hitting her. Staff 1 reported APM 1 did a bruise
chart on Youth A after the incident, but she didn’t see any injuries
on Youth A at the time. Staff 1 reported Youth A has bad dry skin
and scratches at his skin often, so any scratches he had might
have been self-inflicted. Staff 1 showed her nails during the
interview, and her nails did not appear long enough to be able to
leave scratch marks.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/29/25
in collaboration with Law Enforcement and MDHHS Worker 1.
Staff 2 reported she was the medication passer for the day, so she
told Youth A it was time to get his medications. Staff 2 reported
Staff 1 told her to hold off on Youth A’s medications because he
wasn’t safe or meeting expectations. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was
sitting down at the time, and Youth A dropped his stuff on the
ground and lunged at Staff 1. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 held up her
arm to block Youth A from hitting her and then Staff 1 stood up.
Staff 2 reported she left to take care of the rest of the youth on the
unit, so she didn’t see anything after. Staff 2 reported Staff 1
repeatedly reminded Youth A of the expectations and told him not
to put his hands on staff. Staff 2 reported she didn’t see Staff 1 do
or say anything concerning while she was present.
5

Assistant Program Manager 2 (APM 2) was interviewed face
to face at the facility on 7/29/25 in collaboration with Law
Enforcement and MDHHS Worker 1. APM 2 reported she saw
Youth A come down the hallway, drop his clothes on the floor,
then pick up his clothes with an attitude, and walk back down the
hallway. APM 2 reported she heard a commotion, so she walked
Youth C to his room to get him out of the area. APM 2 reported as
she did, she saw Staff 1 standing by the laundry room. APM 2
reported APM 1 was behind Staff 4 and Youth A was standing in
between Staff 1 and Staff 4. APM 2 reported she didn’t see
anything else that happened because she was down the hallway
with the other youth when Youth A escalated.
Nurse was interviewed via phone on 8/11/25 in collaboration
with MDHHS Worker 1. Nurse reported Manager of Program
Operations called her into an office to check on Youth A after the
incident, but Nurse wasn’t present during the incident. Nurse
reported Youth A had a superficial scratch on the bend of his right
elbow, which was long/narrow like a fingernail scratch, but it was
not scabbing or bleeding. Youth A could not identify where the
scratch came from. Nurse reported Youth A had a red scratch
mark on his left forearm, but Youth A told Nurse the scratch was
from a peer and occurred when they were playing. Nurse reported
Youth A’s left arm had a bruise, which Youth A disclosed was the
result of his family dog. Nurse reported Youth A also had
abrasions on both his knees which were consistent with a possible
rug burn. Nurse reported Youth A also had a bruise on his upper
right chest by his clavicle and a red mark by his sternum. Youth A
told Nurse he got mad at staff (didn’t say who) and punched at
them, and when staff contained him, he and staff fell, but he didn’t
say how they fell. Nurse reported Youth A did not complain about
anyone grabbing him, scratching him, pushing him, etc. while he
was talking about his injuries. Nurse reported she did not see
anything concerning regarding Youth A’s injuries.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on 8/11/25 in collaboration
with MDHHS Worker 1. Staff 3 reported she was on another unit
when she heard through the door Youth A was mad because of
something Staff 1 said to him about the shower. Staff 3 looked
through the window on the door and saw Youth A swinging his
arms at Staff 1 and Staff 1 blocking Youth A’s advances. Staff 3
reported Staff 1 attempted to restrain Youth A, but he dropped
weight and landed on his knees, so Staff 1 let him go. Staff 3
reported Staff 1 restrained Youth A appropriately and she didn’t
see anything concerning. Staff 3 reported she walked through the
6

door onto Youth A’s unit and Youth A was still on the floor. Staff 3
reported Youth A then got up and ran down the hallway. Staff 3
reported she and Staff 1 asked Youth A to walk to the cafeteria,
but he refused. Staff 3 reported she and Staff 1 attempted a 2-
person escort to guide him into the cafeteria, but Youth A dropped
his weight to the floor and landed on his knees, so they removed
their hands from the escort position. Staff 3 reported she left to
assist in getting the other youth off the unit for safety, so she didn’t
see the rest of the incident. Staff 3 reported when she was with
Staff 1, she did not see Staff 1 grab Youth A by his collar or his
neck, or do anything concerning towards Youth A.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on 8/19/25 in collaboration
with MDHHS Worker 3. Staff 4 reported she was on C-unit and
heard a lot of commotion on the other unit through the door. Staff
4 reported she went through the door to see what was going on.
Staff 4 reported Youth A was swinging his arms at Staff 1 and
Staff 1 was blocking his advances. Staff 4 reported she has a
good relationship with Youth A, so she attempted to talk him down
and de-escalate him. Staff 4 reported Youth A backed off a bit and
went down the hall. Staff 4 reported Case Manager was by the
door at the end of the hall. Staff 4 reported Youth A got riled up
again, so she went down the hallway to talk to him. Case Manager
advised Staff 4 and Staff 1 to escort Youth A to the cafeteria, so
they tried. However, Youth A dropped weight down to his knees
and body, so they released him. Staff 4 reported Youth A tried to
kick her and Staff 1 when he was lying on the floor, so they both
moved out of the way. Staff 4 reported all other youth were taken
to another unit by other staff (didn’t say who) for safety. Staff 4
reported APM 1 was standing at the other end of the hall. Staff 4
reported they told Youth A to go to the milieu, but he refused at
first. Then Youth A got up and started walking but quickly turned
around and attacked Staff 1 again. Staff 4 reported she opened
the cafeteria door and when she turned around, Youth A was
yelling, “I’m going to kill this black bitch” towards Staff 1. Staff 4
reported APM 1 escorted Youth A into the cafeteria and blocked
Youth A from going after Staff 1 again. Staff 4 reported Staff 1
never hit, scratched, grabbed, or pushed Youth A during the
incident. Staff 4 reported she and Staff 1 never restrained Youth
A; they only tried to escort him, but he dropped weight, so they
went hands off. Staff 4 reported Youth A never tried to crawl
through their legs, and they never pushed him backwards.
Clinician was interviewed via phone on 8/19/25 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker 3. Clinician reported she met
with Youth A for therapy and asked about the incident. Youth A
7

told Clinician Staff 1 wouldn’t let him take his medications or go
back to his room, so he got upset and put his hands on her. Youth
A told Clinician Staff 1 grabbed him by the shirt and pushed him to
the floor. Clinician reported she saw scratches on his neck, and
marks on his arms and knees, but she’s not sure what happened
or if the marks were from the incident since she wasn’t present.
Clinician reported there have been 2-3 times Youth A was
“ramped up” and she has witnessed Staff 1 feed into his behavior
more than she de-escalates it. Clinician reported she has verbally
coached Staff 1 during these instances and notified Manager of
Program Operations about the concern.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Activities of Daily Living Skills (ADLs) listed below must be
completed prior to breakfast: shower, brush teeth, remove
soiled clothes and towels from bathroom, make bed, clean
room of all toys/papers/items on floor, sweep/mop floor
independently or with staff assistance. All listed activities
are a requirement to participate in activities for the day.
• Youth A’s injuries were viewed in collaboration with
MDHHS Worker 2 (and pictures were taken) on 7/24/25.
They were consistent with Nurse’s interview.
• Treatment Note dated 7/24/25 authored by Nurse is
consistent with Nurse’s interview.
• Youth A’s Individual Safety & Calming Plan states being
asked to wait, being provided with redirection, not having
immediate access to something he wants, or demands
being placed on him are triggers for Youth A. One proactive
strategy to use is to take Youth A to an area where staff
can engage with him 1 on 1 without an audience (i.e.
cafeteria). Crisis intervention strategies include clearing
the space of other peers and staff, offering him space,
remaining calm and speaking calmly.
• Incident Report dated 7/24/25 authored by APM 1 was
consistent with APM 1’s interview.
• Incident Report dated 7/24/25 authored by Staff 1 was
consistent with Staff 1’s interview.
• Discipline Policy states the facility prohibits any type of
corporal punishment inflicted in any manner.
8

• Resident Restraint, Emergency Restraint policy states the
facility prohibits hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling,
or pushing a youth on any part of their body.
• Staff 1 has 4 disciplinary actions in her employee file,
unrelated to this investigation. Staff 1 was trained on
Handle With Care on 10/13/22, 10/14/22, 3/16/23,
11/13/23, 5/8/24, 11/6/24 and 6/30/25.
• Staff 4 does not have any disciplinary actions in her
employee file. Staff 4 was trained on Handle With Care on
10/6/22, 10/7/22, 5/11/23, 9/11/23, 11/13/23, 2/26/24,
7/31/24, 12/9/24 and 5/9/25.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per interviews conducted
and documentation reviewed, there is no information to support
Staff 1 or any other staff grabbed, hit, pushed, pulled, improperly
restrained, or threw Youth A to the ground during the incident.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
The facility should consider additional coaching or check-ins for
Staff 1 due to Clinician’s reports of Staff 1 feeding into Youth A’s
behaviors multiple times rather than de-escalating him.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
